page.title: 06BOY SCOUTS
page.content: Langwith Scout Troop meet every Saturday morning at 10.00a.m. in the Holy Cross Church Hall.There are 12 members of the troop and their ages range from 11 to 15years.The troop is run by Ben Launders,who outlines each patrols assignments and checks progress during the session.The assignments are based on a variety of skills and crafts such as erecting a tent,orienteering,absailing,knot tying,cooking,conservation exercises,nature study and swimming,for which badges are awarded on completion.The troop is divided into two patrols,Kingfisher and Kestrel,who compete against each other in the skills and crafts of scouting as well as sporting events such as football,pool and table tennis.This year the troop are attending the International Jamboree at Chatsworth.
